buildup.text: Kenneth Doka coined disenfranchised grief for losses society doesn't acknowledge or validate.

discovery.text: Miscarriage, pet loss, estranged relationships, and ex-partner deaths often go unrecognized.

twist.text: When others don't acknowledge your grief, you may question whether your pain is legitimate.

climax.text: Lack of social support amplifies grief and increases the risk of complications.

punchline.text: All loss deserves to be mourned, even the ones society ignores.

quiz.question: What is disenfranchised grief?
options: Grief for losses society doesn't acknowledge or validate
